dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That 7.3% drop across the major indices, just minutes into Harris's speech—that's a massive reaction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That seven point three percent drop across the major indices, just minutes into Harris's speech-that's a massive reaction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just stocks—WTI crude took a hit too, down 4.5% after she mentioned tapping the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just stocks-W T I crude took a hit too, down four point five percent after she mentioned tapping the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Jeff Bezos was there, uh, promising Amazon would scale back production to help with supply chain issues. Interesting to see corporate leaders aligning publicly like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Jeff Bezos was there, uh, promising Amazon would scale back production to help with supply chain issues. Interesting to see corporate leaders aligning publicly like that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But investors are still waiting on that climate relief bill—Janet Yellen and Mitch McConnell both signaling it's not coming soon. That uncertainty isn't helping.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But investors are still waiting on that climate relief bill-Janet Yellen and Mitch McConnell both signaling it's not coming soon. That uncertainty isn't helping.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors are still anxiously awaiting a coronavirus relief bill; both Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi have indicated that the bills passage is imminent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And yet, somehow the Dow is still up 2% for the week. Wild swings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet, somehow the Dow is still up two percent for the week. Wild swings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The VIX spiking back up to around 77 tells you everything—fear is definitely back in the market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The V I X spiking back up to around seventy seven tells you everything-fear is definitely back in the market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, Apple took a separate hit, down 9% after Harris criticized their testing site. Not their best day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, Apple took a separate hit, down nine percent after Harris criticized their testing site. Not their best day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big number: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got this oil price war between Russia and France complicating things further—just adds another layer of chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got this oil price war between Russia and France complicating things further-just adds another layer of chaos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tangent: Russia and Saudi Arabia entered a full-out price war over oil production this week after negotiations over supply cuts to prop up the industry fell apart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Even with cases decreasing and companies like Delta starting to hire again, the market's just so skittish right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even with cases decreasing and companies like Delta starting to hire again, the market's just so skittish right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Key background: Confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the United States continued to grow at an alarming rate this week, with more than 1,741 infected and 41 people dead as of Friday. Many companies are implementing mandatory work from policies, and others, like Norwegian Air, are already beginning to lay off workers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that sobering quote—bear markets are exciting but eventually lead to crashes. History isn't exactly reassuring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that sobering quote-bear markets are exciting but eventually lead to crashes. History isn't exactly reassuring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crucial quote: While it is hard to tell when and where the market will bottom, we do know that the market has always recovered from bear markets, says Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest. Bear markets are unnerving, but history shows stocks eventually recover.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Two months on average to recoup losses though? That feels almost optimistic given how things are moving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two months on average to recoup losses though? That feels almost optimistic given how things are moving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, it may take a while to get back to new highs the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in all bear markets since 1946.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And with the 10-Year Treasury yield falling to 0.681%, it's clear people are fleeing to safety.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And with the ten-Year Treasury yield falling to zero point six eight one percent, it's clear people are fleeing to safety.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's like every piece of news—good or bad—is just magnified right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's like every piece of news-good or bad-is just magnified right now.

HostB: And then you’ve got this oil price war between Russia and France complicating things further—just adds another layer of chaos.
HostA: Even with cases decreasing and companies like Delta starting to hire again, the market’s just so skittish right now.
HostB: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that sobering quote—bear markets are exciting but eventually lead to crashes. History isn’t exactly reassuring.
HostA: Two months on average to recoup losses though? That feels almost optimistic given how things are moving.
HostB: For sure. And with the 10-Year Treasury yield falling to 0.681%, it’s clear people are fleeing to safety.
